summary.para: Called when a key down event occurs.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL value that, on exit, indicates if the key event is handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event is handled. If this value is FALSE, the key event is not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Called when a key up event occurs.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL value that, on exit, indicates if the key event is handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event is handled. If this value receives FALSE, the key event is not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Called to determine if a text service will handle a key down event.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL value that, on exit, indicates if the key event is handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event is handled. If this value is FALSE, the key event is not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Called to determine if a text service will handle a key up event.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL value that, on exit, indicates if the key event is handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event is handled. If this value receives FALSE, the key event would is not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: The ITfContextKeyEventSink interface is implemented by a text service to receive keyboard event notifications that occur in an input context. This keyboard event sink differs from the keyboard event sink in that the keyboard events are passed to ITfContextKeyEventSink after having been preprocessed by the ITfKeyEventSink event sink. Preserved key events and filtered key events are not passed to the ITfContextKeyEventSink event sink.
This event sink is installed by with IID_ITfContextKeyEventSink.
